title.narrative: HH BEHAVIOURS & SOCIAL CHANGE FOR NUTRIT

description.narrative: Capacities of implementing partners in 15 selected districts enhanced to promote appropriate household behaviors and social change for maternal nutrition, infant and young child feeding and care practices* to increase resilience in the community.

sector.narrative: Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
Maternal nutrition, including information, supplementation and counselling
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

title.narrative: Malawi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Malawi 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Malawi 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Malawi 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacities of implementing partners in 15 selected districts enhanced to promote appropriate household behaviors and social change for maternal nutrition, infant and young child feeding and care practices* to increase resilience in the community.

description.narrative: Capacities of implementing partners in fifteen targeted districts (100%) were enhanced to implement the minimum package to prevent stunting, reaching 220,897 children under-two years against a target of 322,199 (69%) and 37,846 pregnant women (100%) resulting in improved MIYCN and care practices contributing to increased resilience. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/12/2018

title.narrative: Percentage of districts implementing the minimum package to prevent stunting in children
Number of primary caregivers of children aged 0-23 months who received counselling on IYCF
Proportion of mothers of children under two received counselling on key child caring practices in 14 districts ( EBF, CF, HIV, sanitation , hygiene and health)
Number of Community Health Workers trained with UNICEF support to provide infant and young child feeding counselling services in the reporting year
